patterns: please provide sports and games information
responses:
Sona College of Technology offers a plethora of opportunities to the staff and students to stay fit and fine both mentally and physically. The various indoor and outdoor games facilitate rejuvenation to the mind, body and soul. Students have bagged several awards at district, state and national levels thereby escalating the status of the college. For more details visit

At our college, we take mental health very seriously. We offer a range of resources to support students in managing their mental health, including counseling services, stress management workshops, and therapy options. Our mental health professionals are trained to provide support for a variety of concerns, including anxiety and depression. Additionally, we offer peer support programs and self-care tips to help students prioritize their mental well-being. If you'd like to learn more, please visit our website or schedule an appointment with our counseling center.

Our college offers peer tutoring services for students who need academic support. Our peer tutors are students who have excelled in their coursework and are trained to help their peers understand course material, review for exams, and develop effective study strategies. Peer tutoring is a great way to get extra help with a subject, and can be especially helpful for students who are struggling to keep up with coursework. If you're interested in peer tutoring, please contact our tutoring center or visit our website for more information.

Our college provides WiFi access to all students and staff members. If you're having trouble connecting to the network or experiencing slow speeds, please try resetting your device or moving closer to a WiFi access point. If the issue persists, please contact our IT help desk for troubleshooting support. For guests, we offer a separate guest WiFi network that can be accessed with a provided password. Additionally, if you're planning an event on campus and require WiFi access, please contact our event services team to make arrangements.

In the event of an emergency, our college has established procedures and protocols to ensure the safety of our students and staff members. Our emergency preparedness plan includes an evacuation plan and guidelines for responding to various types of emergencies, such as medical emergencies, natural disasters, and active shooter situations. We also have an emergency contact list that includes local emergency services and key personnel on campus. It's important to familiarize yourself with our emergency procedures and be prepared in case of an emergency. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact our campus security or visit our website for more information.

Our college offers internship opportunities for students to gain valuable work experience and develop practical skills in their field of study. Our internship programs are designed to provide students with hands-on learning opportunities and prepare them for successful careers after graduation. Internship requirements and eligibility may vary by program, so it's important to check with the appropriate department or program coordinator for specific details. Some of the benefits of participating in an internship include building professional connections, enhancing your resume, and gaining a deeper understanding of your field. To learn more about internship opportunities and deadlines, please visit our website or contact our career services office.

Our college has a partnership with the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), which is responsible for promoting technical education in India and ensuring the quality of technical education in the country. AICTE approves and accredits courses and programs in engineering, technology, architecture, and management, among others. Our AICTE-approved programs are designed to provide students with a high-quality education and prepare them for successful careers in their chosen field. AICTE recognition and accreditation are important factors to consider when choosing a college or program. To learn more about our AICTE partnership, approved courses and programs, and other related information, please visit our website or contact our admissions office.

Our college has a team of dedicated class counselors who are available to provide academic and personal support to students. Our class counselors are trained professionals who can help students with academic planning, course selection, and academic progress monitoring. In addition, they provide personal counseling and guidance to help students manage stress, overcome personal challenges, and achieve their goals. Our career counselors can also help students explore career options, develop career plans, and prepare for job interviews. To learn more about our class counselors and academic support services, please visit our website or contact our counseling office.

Our college provides a wide range of entertainment opportunities for students, including cultural events, music concerts, dance performances, drama performances, art exhibitions, film screenings, fashion shows, talent shows, and festivals. These events are designed to provide students with an opportunity to showcase their talents, meet new people, and have fun. Our entertainment events are open to all students, and we encourage everyone to participate and get involved. To learn more about upcoming events and how you can get involved, please visit our website or contact our student activities office.

Our college has a strong and active alumni network that provides a wide range of support to current students and recent graduates. Our alumni association organizes events and activities that bring together alumni, students, and faculty to share their experiences and insights. Alumni mentorship programs are available to help students connect with successful alumni in their chosen fields and get career advice and guidance. Our alumni also contribute to the college through donations and other forms of support, which helps us to continue providing high-quality education and opportunities to our students. To learn more about our alumni network and how you can get involved, please visit our website or contact our alumni office.

The Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) department at our college is one of the most reputed and sought-after departments in the country. Our department has a team of experienced and dedicated faculty members who are committed to providing high-quality education to our students. We offer a wide range of CSE courses that cover various aspects of computer science and engineering. Our CSE syllabus is designed to provide our students with a solid foundation in the fundamentals of computer science and engineering, as well as advanced knowledge in specialized areas. Our CSE labs are equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and technologies to provide hands-on experience to our students. Our CSE placements are some of the best in the country, with many of our students being recruited by top companies in the industry. Our CSE research efforts are focused on cutting-edge technologies and applications that have the potential to transform the industry and society. To learn more about our CSE department, please visit our website at
For More Details Here

The Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) department at our college regularly organizes a wide range of events, workshops, seminars, conferences, hackathons, and guest lectures to provide our students with opportunities to learn from experts in the field, network with their peers and professionals, and stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in the industry. Some of our upcoming CSE events include [list of events]. To learn more about our CSE events and to register, please visit our website at
For More Details Here

Sona College of Technology was established in the year 1997 by the Thiyagarajar Polytechnic Trust with the objective of providing world-class technical education to students from all over India and beyond. The college is affiliated with Anna University, Chennai and is accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA). The college has a vision to be a premier technical institution that nurtures and empowers future leaders with sound technical knowledge, skills, and ethical values. Our mission is to provide an inspiring learning environment that fosters creativity, innovation, and excellence in teaching, research, and service. To learn more about the history and vision of Sona College of Technology, please visit our website at
For More Details Here.

Sona College of Technology was founded by Thiru. M.S. Chockalingam, a visionary and philanthropist, in the year 1997. Thiru. M.S. Chockalingam was a pioneer in the field of agriculture, and his love for education led him to establish the Thiyagarajar Polytechnic Trust in 1956 with the aim of promoting technical education in the region. The trust has since established several educational institutions, including Sona College of Technology. Thiru. M.S. Chockalingam's vision and leadership have been instrumental in shaping the growth and development of the college. To learn more about the founder of Sona College of Technology, please visit our website at
For More Details Here .

At Sona College of Technology, we are committed to upholding a set of core values that guide our actions and decisions. These values include academic excellence, student-centeredness, creativity and innovation, ethical behavior, social responsibility, and respect for diversity. We believe in providing an environment that fosters intellectual curiosity and personal growth, and encourages students to become lifelong learners and responsible citizens. Our faculty and staff are dedicated to providing quality education that prepares students for successful careers and leadership roles in their respective fields. To learn more about the core values of Sona College of Technology, please visit our website at
For More Details Here.

patterns: what is the perspective plan of sona college

Sona College of Technology has a well-defined perspective plan that outlines our goals and aspirations for the future. Our vision is to be a globally recognized institution of higher education that provides quality education and fosters innovation and entrepreneurship. Our perspective plan focuses on four key areas: academic excellence, research and innovation, industry-institute partnerships, and community outreach. We are committed to providing our students with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in the global economy, and to creating an environment that encourages creativity, collaboration, and lifelong learning. To learn more about the perspective plan of Sona College of Technology, please visit our website at
For More Details Here .

We strive to create an environment that fosters creativity, innovation, and collaboration, and to provide our students with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in their chosen fields. To ensure the quality of our programs and services, we have established a Quality Assurance Cell that monitors and evaluates our performance against established benchmarks and standards. We are also committed to complying with all relevant regulations and standards, and to promoting ethical behavior and social responsibility. To learn more about the quality policy of Sona College of Technology

patterns: what are the activities conducted by ISTE at Sona
responses: The Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE) student chapter at Sona College of Technology conducts several activities to enhance the skills of the students. The activities include expert talks, workshops, seminars, conferences, and hands-on training sessions. The objective is to provide a platform for students to stay up-to-date with the latest technological advancements and to develop their technical skills. For more details, please visit ISTE Professional Society Activities

At Sona College of Technology, we uphold high standards of professional conduct, ethics, and values. We strive to foster a culture of professionalism in education and prepare our students to become ethical and responsible professionals who make a positive impact on society. You can learn more about our Professional Code of Ethics and Conduct at Professional Code.

patterns: What are the rules and regulations at Sona College of Technology?
Can you tell me about the college policies?
What are the academic regulations at Sona College of Technology?
What are the guidelines for attendance?
Tell me about the disciplinary rules at SCT
responses: Sona College of Technology has a set of rules and regulations in place to ensure a safe and healthy environment for all students and staff. The college expects students to maintain discipline, attend classes regularly, and abide by the academic policies. The rules also cover areas such as dress code, usage of electronic devices, and prohibited activities within the campus. For detailed information on the rules and regulations, please visit <a style="color: white;" target="_blank" href="https://www.sonatech.ac.in/academics/rules-regulations.php">For Regulations/a>.

At Sona College of Technology, we understand the importance of mental health and emotional well-being in the overall development of our students. Our student counseling center offers confidential and professional services to support students in dealing with personal and mental health issues. Our trained counselors provide therapeutic support and guidance to help students manage their stress, anxiety, and depression, and maintain a healthy work-life balance.

The Sona Career Planning and Development Centre (CPDC) assists students in developing their career and employment prospects by providing guidance, resources, and opportunities. The CPDC conducts several activities throughout the year, including workshops, industry interactions, and campus recruitment. In addition, the centre collaborates with industry partners to offer internships and job opportunities to students. For more details, please visit CPDC Details Here.

Life at Sona College of Technology is not just about education, it's about the overall development of an individual. We have a vibrant campus with a plethora of extracurricular activities and events that are organized throughout the year. Our students participate in various cultural, technical, and sports events and have won accolades at the national and international level. The college also has a wide range of student clubs that cater to different interests, providing opportunities for students to explore their passions and skills. Our hostel facilities provide a comfortable and safe living environment with all basic amenities. Join the Sona community and experience a fulfilling student life!

Sona College of Technology has a diverse range of clubs that cater to the interests of students, be it in sports, arts, culture or technology. The clubs include Robotics club, Quiz club, Dance club, Music club, Literary club, Photography club, Yoga club, and many more. These clubs offer ample opportunities to the students to showcase their talent and enhance their skills outside of the academic curriculum.

At Sona College of Technology, we believe in adopting innovative teaching and learning processes to enhance the academic experience for our students. Our faculty members use a variety of techniques such as personalized learning, flipped classrooms, blended learning, gamification, project-based learning, and collaborative learning to make the learning process engaging and interactive. We also leverage technology to create a dynamic learning environment and promote experiential learning. To know more about our innovative teaching and learning processes, please visit
Innovative Teaching and Learning Processes.

Blackboard is the learning management system (LMS) used by Sona College of Technology to facilitate online learning and course management. It provides a virtual classroom environment where students can access course materials, submit assignments, participate in discussions, take quizzes, and interact with instructors and peers. Blackboard is a powerful e-learning platform that enables us to offer quality education to students, regardless of their location. Our faculty members are well-versed in using Blackboard to create engaging and interactive online courses that meet the needs of today's learners. To learn more about Blackboard and how to use it, please visit
Blackboard.

Sona College of Technology uses a lecture capture system to record and archive classroom lectures, making them available to students for review or catch-up. The system captures both audio and video of the lecture and makes it available online through a secure digital archive. Students can access the recorded lectures at their convenience, from anywhere with an internet connection. This technology is especially useful for students who miss a class or need to review a lecture for better understanding. Additionally, some faculty members use lecture capture to create flipped classroom videos, which replace traditional lectures and allow students to learn at their own pace. To know more about the lecture capture system and how to access recorded lectures, please visit
Lecture Capture System.

At Sona College of Technology, we use Blackboard as our digital course management system, which allows students to submit assignments, quizzes, and tests online. Blackboard provides a secure and easy-to-use platform for submitting assignments, where students can upload files, add comments, and receive feedback from instructors. To submit an assignment, simply log in to Blackboard and navigate to the appropriate course and assignment. Follow the instructions provided on the assignment page to upload your file and submit it for grading. With Blackboard, students do not need to worry about printing and handing in physical copies of their work, saving them time and effort. To learn more about submitting assignments through Blackboard, please visit
Blackboard.

At Sona College of Technology, we have a dedicated Faculty Development Cell (FDC) that provides professional development opportunities for our faculty members. The FDC offers a range of teacher training programs, workshops, and mentoring sessions to help our faculty develop their teaching skills and stay up-to-date with the latest pedagogical trends and technologies. Our faculty members are encouraged to participate in FDC activities and take advantage of the innovative teaching methods and resources provided by the FDC. With a focus on continuous learning and growth, the FDC plays a crucial role in ensuring that our faculty members are equipped with the skills and knowledge they need to provide the best possible education to our students. To learn more about the FDC and its initiatives, please visit
Faculty Development Cell (FDC).

Sona College of Technology is an NPTEL Local Chapter, which means that we offer our students access to a wide range of online certification courses provided by NPTEL. NPTEL is a joint initiative of IITs and IISc that provides high-quality e-learning courses in engineering, science, and humanities. As a Local Chapter, Sona College of Technology offers students the opportunity to learn from NPTEL's expert faculty through video lectures, online quizzes, and assignments. Students who successfully complete an NPTEL course can earn a certificate of completion from NPTEL. To register for an NPTEL course, students can visit the Sona NPTEL website and follow the registration process. For more information about Sona NPTEL and the courses we offer, please visit
Sona NPTEL.

Sona College of Technology provides handbooks for students and faculty members that contain important information about the college's policies, procedures, and regulations. The handbooks cover a range of topics, including academic rules and regulations, grading policies, code of conduct, and campus resources. The handbooks are available for download on the Sona College website and are also distributed to students and faculty members at the beginning of each academic year. We encourage all members of the Sona College community to familiarize themselves with the information contained in the handbooks and to refer to them as needed throughout the academic year. To download the handbooks, please visit
Sona Handbooks.

The Controller of Examinations (COE) is responsible for overseeing all aspects of the examination process at Sona College of Technology. The COE office is responsible for setting exam schedules, enforcing exam rules and regulations, and ensuring the accurate and timely publication of exam results. The COE office also manages the administration of exams, including the preparation of question papers, the allocation of examination halls, and the supervision of exam invigilators. Our COE and staff work diligently to ensure that our examination system is fair, transparent, and efficient. To learn more about the examination process at Sona College of Technology, including exam rules and regulations, exam schedules, and results, please visit
Controller of Examinations.

The Controller of Examinations (COE) office publishes the exam schedule for each semester on the Sona College of Technology website. The exam schedule provides information on the dates, times, and venues of all exams for the current semester. Students are advised to check the exam schedule regularly to ensure that they are aware of the exam dates and times. The exam schedule is typically published several weeks before the start of the exam period, and any changes or updates to the schedule will be communicated to students as soon as possible. To view the exam schedule for the current semester, please visit
Exam Schedule.

Sona College of Technology conducts both internal and external assessments to evaluate student performance. Internal assessments are conducted by faculty members and include assignments, quizzes, and tests that are administered throughout the semester. External assessments, on the other hand, are conducted by the Controller of Examinations (COE) and include mid-semester and end-semester exams. The COE publishes the assessment schedule on the Sona College website, which includes dates and times for all internal and external assessments. Students are advised to familiarize themselves with the assessment schedule and to prepare accordingly. To view the assessment schedule and learn more about the types of assessments conducted at Sona College of Technology, please visit
Internal and External Tests.

Sona Know Your Hall is a feature of the Controller of Examinations (COE) office that allows students to view their exam hall details and download their hall tickets online. To access Sona Know Your Hall, students must log in to the Sona College website and follow the instructions provided. The hall ticket contains important information such as the exam date, time, and location, and students are advised to bring their hall ticket with them to the exam. The COE office also publishes information on the exam center and location on the Sona College website, which can be accessed by students who need to know where their exam hall is located. To learn more about Sona Know Your Hall and how to access your hall ticket and exam hall details, please visit
Sona Know Your Hall.

The Controller of Examinations (COE) at Sona College of Technology publishes an annual report that provides a comprehensive overview of the college's academic performance, including information on student performance, exam results, and academic achievements. The annual report is published on the Sona College website and is available for download. The annual report provides important information on the college's academic programs and initiatives, and serves as a valuable resource for students, faculty members, and other stakeholders. To download the annual report and learn more about the academic performance of Sona College of Technology, please visit
Annual Report.

The Controller of Examinations (COE) office at Sona College of Technology provides various forms related to exams and academic records. These forms include Recommendation for Revaluation, Revaluation Procedure, CGPA to Percentage/Medium of Instructions/WES/CES/ICAS, Duplicate Certificate, Re-Test Form, Improvement Test Form, Condonation Form, Malpractice penalty and punishment, QP Pattern, and Transcript. These forms can be downloaded from the Sona College website and are available to students and alumni. To access the COE forms and learn more about their use, please visit
COE Forms.

Sona College of Technology has a dedicated Placement Cell that works to connect students with job and internship opportunities. The Placement Cell has established relationships with a wide range of companies across various industries and sectors. These companies visit the Sona College campus each year to recruit students for full-time and internship positions. The list of recruiters who have visited the campus in the past is available on the Sona College website. The Placement Cell also organizes recruitment drives and other events to facilitate job and internship opportunities for students. To learn more about the companies that recruit at Sona College of Technology and the job and internship opportunities available to students, please visit
Recruiters.

Sona College of Technology has established strong ties with various industries and companies through its Industry-Academia Collaboration program. The program facilitates collaborations and partnerships with industry experts and companies to enhance the educational experience of students and to promote innovation and research. The Industrial Collaboration program includes industrial visits, industrial projects, industry research, industry experts, industry training, industry exposure, and industrial outreach. The program also promotes corporate partnerships and collaborations to provide students with real-world experience and to keep the curriculum up-to-date with industry needs. To learn more about the Industry-Academia Collaboration program and the industrial collaborations and partnerships established by Sona College of Technology, please visit
Industrial Collaborations.

Sona College of Technology has a dedicated Career Planning Center that provides a range of career services to students and alumni. The Career Planning Center offers career guidance, career development, job search support, career counseling, and a variety of career workshops and events throughout the academic year. The Center also organizes job fairs and other career events to connect students with potential employers and job opportunities. Additionally, the Career Planning Center provides career resources to students and alumni, including access to job search databases, resume and cover letter templates, and interview preparation materials. To learn more about the Career Planning Center and the career services and resources available to students and alumni, please visit
Career Planning Center.

patterns: how can i succeed in my life
responses: Sona College of Technology recognizes the importance of soft skills in today's job market and offers a range of training programs to help students develop their soft skills. Soft skills include communication skills, teamwork, leadership skills, time management, problem-solving skills, stress management, interpersonal skills, emotional intelligence, and self-awareness. The college offers training programs and workshops that focus on developing these skills, as well as interview preparation and techniques to eliminate stage fear and handle critical situations. Students are also encouraged to participate in activities such as student clubs and organizations, sports teams, and community service projects to further develop their soft skills. To learn more about the soft skills training programs and resources available to students at Sona College of Technology, please visit the Career Planning Center or the Soft Skills page on the Sona College website.

intents.tag: Placement Cell Email and Phone Number
responses:
The Placement Cell at Sona College of Technology can be contacted at the following email address and phone numbers:

Email: sonaplacement@sonatech.ac.in
Phone: 94426 01304 / 94425 41438

For more information about the Placement Cell and its services, please visit the Career Planning Center or the Placement Cell page on the Sona College website.

The Sona College of Technology Alumni Association is a strong network of over 50,000 alumni located in different parts of the world. The Association provides a platform for alumni to connect, share experiences and collaborate with each other. It also hosts various events and activities throughout the year, including reunions, workshops, guest lectures and cultural programs. The Association offers several services to alumni, including access to the alumni database, job postings, mentorship programs, and other resources. Alumni can register with the Association through the Sona College Alumni website, which provides a range of benefits and services to its members. To learn more about the Sona College Alumni Association, its services and benefits, please visit
Sona College of Technology Alumni Association.

The Sona College of Technology Library is a valuable resource for students, faculty, and staff. The Library houses a vast collection of books, journals, magazines, and other resources, both in print and electronic formats. The Library provides a range of services to support teaching, learning, and research, including circulation, reference, interlibrary loan, and document delivery services. The Library also has a dedicated archive section that houses rare books, manuscripts, and other historical documents. The Library is open from Monday to Saturday, from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm, and offers membership to students, faculty, and staff. To learn more about the Sona College of Technology Library, its resources, and services, please visit
Sona College of Technology Library.

The Sona College of Technology Library offers a range of services to support teaching, learning, and research. Some of the services provided by the Library include:

1. Current Awareness Service (CAS)
2. Inter Library Loan (ILL)
3. Reference Service
4. Newspaper Clipping Service
5. Book Bank Service
6. Internet Access
7. Online Public Access Catalogue (OPAC)
8. Audio-Video Viewing
9. Photocopying

These services are available to students, faculty, and staff, and are designed to help users find and access the information they need for their academic and research pursuits. To learn more about the library services available at Sona College of Technology, please visit
Sona College of Technology Library.

Sona College of Technology Library offers different types of membership for users outside the college. Our college is an institutional member in DELNET, NDLI, IIM(B), and TERI. Outside users can become members by paying an annual fee and get access to the library's resources as per the membership type. The annual fee for Industry Members is Rs. 10,000, for Institutional Members is Rs. 5,000, and for Individuals is Rs. 1,000. The number of books that can be borrowed depends on the membership type, with Industry Members able to borrow up to 3 books, Institutional Members able to borrow up to 2 books, and Individuals having reference-only access. The loan period for all membership types is 7 days. Becoming a member of the Sona College of Technology Library provides access to a vast collection of books, journals, magazines, and other resources, both in print and electronic formats, as well as access to various library services. For more information on the benefits of library membership and the application process, please visit the Sona College of Technology Library website at
Sona College of Technology Library.

The placement package offered to students at Sona College of Technology varies depending on the company and the job profile. The average package offered to students is around 4.5 LPA, while the maximum package offered is up to 25 LPA. The college has a strong placement record, with many leading companies visiting the campus for recruitment. The placement statistics and report are available on the college website and can provide more detailed information on the companies that have recruited students from the college, the job profiles offered, and the salary packages offered. To learn more about the placement opportunities available at Sona College of Technology, please visit the Placement Cell page on the college website.

The Sona College of Technology Library is divided into various sections, each catering to specific user needs. One such section is the Digital Library, which provides access to a range of e-resources and online resources. One of the e-resources available through the Digital Library is IEEE Xplore, which provides access to a vast collection of IEEE papers, journals, and conference proceedings. To download an IEEE paper, you need to have an IEEE membership or access through a library that has an institutional subscription to IEEE Xplore.

If you are a member of IEEE, you can download papers directly from the IEEE Xplore website. If you do not have an IEEE membership, you can check with the Sona College of Technology Library to see if they have an institutional subscription to IEEE Xplore. If they do, you can access IEEE papers through the library's website or by visiting the library in person.

For more information on the library sections and the resources available, including IEEE Xplore, please visit the Sona College of Technology Library website at
Sona College of Technology Library.

The Sona College of Technology Library has a team of dedicated and experienced staff who are committed to providing the best possible service to students, faculty, and staff. The head of the library is Mr. N. Sreedharan, who can be contacted at the following address and phone numbers:

Mr. N. Sreedharan
Department of Library,
Sona College of Technology,
Salem - 636 005.
Ph: +91 - 427 - 2443545, 4099881 (direct)
Fax: +91 - 427 - 4099888
Email: librarian@sonatech.ac.in

If you have any questions or concerns related to the library, you can contact the library team members at the above address and phone numbers or send an email to the librarian. The library team members are always happy to assist you with your queries and help you make the most of the library's resources and services.

The Blood Donor's Club at Sona College of Technology is a student-run organization that promotes blood donation and conducts various events and awareness campaigns related to blood donation. The club organizes blood donation camps and drives on a regular basis, and also facilitates the registration of blood groups for interested individuals. Members of the club can also avail of the benefits of becoming a regular blood donor, such as getting a blood donor card and being recognized for their contribution to society. For more information on the Blood Donor's Club and upcoming events, please visit the Sona College of Technology website or contact the club coordinator.

patterns: can you tell about sona college
responses: Sona College of Technology is a premier engineering institution located in Salem, Tamil Nadu, India. The college offers undergraduate and postgraduate courses in various fields of engineering and technology, management, and computer applications. The college has a sprawling campus with state-of-the-art facilities, including modern classrooms, well-equipped laboratories, a central library, sports facilities, and hostel accommodation. Some of the notable achievements of Sona College of Technology include accreditation by NBA, NAAC, and ISO, recognition as a 'Technical Campus' by AICTE, and consistent placement records with top-tier companies. For more information on Sona College of Technology, including its achievements, courses offered, admissions, and placement, please visit the college website or contact the college administration.
